body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, native. Son of John and Elizabeth Reed Lewis. Graduated from Centre College in Danville, Kentucky, in 1843. Married to Sarah H. Rogers on November 29, 1845. Father of John Lewis, Sarah Lewis, George R. Lewis, and Eliza Lewis. Married to Cassandra Johnson. Attorney in Glasgow, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in 1845. Elected member of Kentucky House of Representatives in 1850, 1851, and 1853. Unsuccessful candidate for U.S. Congress in 1857 and 1861. Colonel of the 6th Kentucky Infantry (C.S.A.) from 1861 to 1862. Brevetted to brigadier general of 1st Kentucky Brigade on September 20, 1863. Member of presidential escort during retreat of Jefferson Davis in 1865.
